Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Henley is an attractive market town within Oxfordshire, approximately 7 miles from Reading, and 7 miles from both the M4 and M40 motorways.
Retailers closeby include Monsoon, Starbucks, WH Smith, Fat Face, Crewe Clothing and Sainsbury's Local.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property comprises a brick built mid terrace building with circa 900 sq ft on ground floor and first and second floors of circa 600 and 500 sq ft respectively.

The first and second floors can be accessed separately via a door adjacent to the frontage.

To the rear of the property is space for parking up to 4 vehicles, although 2 of these would need to be tandem spaces.

Tenure
An effectively FRI lease for a term of years expiring 28th December 2031.

Rent
Current Passing Rent of £38,500 per annum exclusive.

EPC
Energy Efficiency rating is E.
Energy Performance Certificate available on request.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £27,250.00 and the rates payable are £13,379.75 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Lease Available In Attractive Market Town Location

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Farringdon is a small town in Oxfordshire and close to the Thames Valley. The unit is situated in a prominent position on Market Place, nearby occupiers include Boots and Costa Coffee.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The available space comprises basement, ground and first floor.

Tenure
The property is held on an FRI lease expiring 23rd June 2021.

Rent
A passing rent of £24,000 per annum exclusive.

Terms
Offers are invited in respect of Barclays’ leasehold interest.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £36,500 and the rates payable are £17,520 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is 48p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The subject premises occup y an attractive building situated in the prime pitch on Queen Street, O xford, at the heart of the city centre .

Retailers within  the immediate vicini ty include Marks &
Spencer's, Fat Face and Hali fax.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over basement and ground floor

Tenure
Leasehold

Rent
Rent on application.

Terms
The property is available by way of a new lease on terms to be agreed.

Rates
To be reassessed

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The subject property is located on New Inn Hall Street, a popular secondary location in Oxford. Nearby retailers include Games workshop and O’Neils Public House.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The shop premises are arranged over ground floor and first floor and consist of the following areas

Tenure
The property is held on an FRI lease due to expire 11th August 2024 at a passing rental of £50,000 per annum exclusive.

Consideration
Incentives available subject to covenant status for an assignment.

Rates
We are informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current rateable value of the property is £ 48,500 and the rates payable are £ 23,831. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Headington is an eastern suburb of Oxford, located approximately 50 miles north west of London.
The subject property is located in a prime corner retail pitch on London Road, Headington.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The bank is arranged over basement, ground and part of first floor. Ground floor consists of the banking hall with office space, whilst the first floor holds staff rooms.

Tenure
The property is held on an existing FRI lease due to expire 28/03/2022 at a passing rent of £83,000 per annum exclusive. There is sublet income, exact details to be confirmed.

Consideration
Offers accepted on the basis of a sublease at a rental in the region of £50,000 per annum.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £42,000.00 and the rates payable are £20,622.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes
